alert.note: Alert for Otter Tail (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 12 at 7:39PM CDT until May 12 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Otter Tail County in west central Minnesota... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 739 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Ottertail Lake, or 18 miles east of Fergus Falls, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Ottertail Lake around 740 PM CDT. Amor around 745 PM CDT. Ottertail around 750 PM CDT. Richville around 755 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Dent and Big McDonald Lake. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
